metadata.title: CVE-2010-4207 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Flash componentinfrastructure in YUI 2.4.0 through 2.8.1, as used in Bugzilla, Moodle, andother products, allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script orHTML via vectors related to charts/assets/charts.swf.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-4207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjs-yui - 2.8.2r1~squeeze-1
No subscription required

moodle - 2.2.2.dfsg-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: yui package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.8.2r1~squeeze-1').
moodle package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2.2.dfsg-2').
webgui: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
loggerhead: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
